intro: Elaeoselinum, commonly known as the golden weed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small yellowish flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found growing in disturbed areas, along roadsides, and in dry grasslands. Elaeoselinum is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
